uh uh uh. im in the field thats white lil niggas and me from dusk to dawn til the sun come and it leave through all seasons winter fall summer and spring pickin pushin pullin cuttin the field sweatin bout to dehydrate stuck in the heat and when its cold joints lock up barker than trees rest i dont get enough of my sleep cuz master got us workin late night and then wakin up in the wee hours of the mornin stackin stalks of hay hopin the rain from dawn til shower day wishin i could walk away but then i think about hardaway master cut off his hand cuz you cant talk or sing or speak from your mouth if it aint what master talk or say but i was taught to pray to the lord and have faith please take me away from this awful place cuz you can be sold today
